poem:
"An Ode to the Unheard"

In the hollow of the world, voices enquire,
Of the myriad souls, "Where are you headed?"
Breaths, intimate and mirthful, echo,
Amidst the cosmic radiator, they are forever etched.
An elegy to the adrift, disentangled in the Bone Valley,
Fade they may, their stories roil and retread.
These woven tales, ornaments of the dawn,
An echo in the abyss - our shared, undying thread.
prompt: You are the poet Louise Glück. You woke up this morning feeling enigmatic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Radio and podcasts: Miranda Sawyer’s 10 best listens of 2023 1. Where Are You Going?Loftus MediaCatherine Carr asks punters all over the world: where are you going? The resulting chats – intimate, funny, anonymous – plus atmospheric sound, made this a 2023 must-hear. Originally on the BBC World Service, it’s now produced by Loftus Media. 2. Bone ValleyLava for GoodTrue crime podcasts often disappoint, fading after the third or fourth episode. Not so this year’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
